txt.en:
'Hoom, little [placeholder], I could use your help once more. I would, hoom-hom, build in this place a -- how would you say it? -- a memorial in honour of the Entwives. Yes, that is the word for it: memorial.

'I would not touch the stones of the Entwives' gardens, but there is other stone to be had in this land, ta-rum! Trolls, foul beasts made by Morgoth in mockery of Ents, dwell in this land. Occasionally, they become trapped in the sunlight and turn to stone.

'Gather this troll-stone and bring it to me. It is fitting, I think, for the foul mockeries to become a memorial.'
'Ah, yes! This shall do nicely, ta-room! You have been most helpful, little [placeholder].'
'Bring me stone from the suntouched trolls, ta-rum, and I will build a memorial for the Entwives.'
The Ent Gnarlstump desires to build a memorial to the Entwives before he leaves the Brown Lands.

Troll-stone can be found throughout the Brown Lands, in the desolation of the Entwives' gardens, and at the Stone-hole, north of Gnarlstump's camp.\n\nGnarlstump has asked you to gather troll-stone so that he can build a memorial to the Entwives.
Bring the troll-stone to Gnarlstump in the Brown Lands
Gnarlstump is at his camp near the desolation of the Entwives' gardens in the Brown Lands.\n\nYou should bring the troll-stone you collected to Gnarlstump.
